name: coextensively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that reaches the same limits or covers the same area: Sexual orientation is now generally agreed to date from the earliest years of childhood, and to develop coextensively with mind, memory, and personality. In these counties, both companies are licensed coextensively to operate stores.
More examplesFewer examplesThe state is able to regulate commerce coextensively with the federal government.The disease seems to occur coextensively with the culture of tobacco in the state.That court found it necessary to interpret the two words coextensively.
